attributes.action: Start teaching Ethnic Minority History in schools from Primary years
attributes.additional_details: London is multicultural city! We have people of many different ethnicities attending the schools, so the schools should put black & other ethnic minority history back on the school curriculum! Not only would you be educating children about their culture and history you are giving other children an insight on the many cultures of the world.
attributes.background: I believe that the educational system is very ethnocentric. I believe that every race should learn about other history’s such as Black History as well as White British History. In my secondary school, they did the bare minimum celebrate black history months let alone teach it.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign: 

 

Add education on diversity and racism to all school curriculums: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323808 

 

Making the UK education curriculum more inclusive of BAME history: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/323961 

 

Teach Britain's colonial past as part of the UK's compulsory curriculum: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324092 

 

Introduce Gender and Race equity for GCSE English Literature set texts: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/324934
